1.name: Gone with the Wind
1.description: A manipulative woman and a roguish man conduct a turbulent romance during the American Civil War and Reconstruction periods.

2.name: The Wizard of Oz
2.description: Dorothy Gale is swept away from a farm in Kansas to a magical land of Oz in a tornado and embarks on a quest with her new friends to see the Wizard who can help her return home to Kansas and help her friends as well.

3.name: Stagecoach
3.description: A group of people traveling on a stagecoach find their journey complicated by the threat of Geronimo and learn something about each other in the process.

4.name: Wuthering Heights
4.description: A servant in the house of Wuthering Heights tells a traveller the unfortunate tale of lovers Cathy (Merle Oberon) and Heathcliff (Sir Laurence Olivier).

5.name: Juarez
5.description: Louis Napoleon III takes advantage of the American Civil War to circumvent the Monroe Doctrine and expand his power by helping Emperor Maximillian Hapsburg to add Mexico to his empire. of Mexico.

6.name: Mr. Smith Goes to Washington
6.description: A naive man is appointed to fill a vacancy in the United States Senate. His plans promptly collide with political corruption, but he doesn't back down.

7.name: The Hunchback of Notre Dame
7.description: In 15th century France, a gypsy girl is framed for murder by the infatuated Chief Justice, and only the deformed bellringer of Notre Dame Cathedral can save her.

8.name: The Hound of the Baskervilles
8.description: Sherlock Holmes and Dr Watson investigate the legend of a supernatural hound, a beast that may be stalking a young heir on the fog-shrouded moorland that makes up his estate.

9.name: Ninotchka
9.description: A stern Russian woman sent to Paris on official business finds herself attracted to a man who represents everything she is supposed to detest.

10.name: La règle du jeu
10.description: A bourgeois life in France at the onset of World War II, as the rich and their poor servants meet up at a French chateau.

11.name: The Women
11.description: A study of the lives and romantic entanglements of various interconnected women.

12.name: Dark Victory
12.description: A young socialite is diagnosed with an inoperable brain tumor, and must decide whether or not she'll meet her final days with dignity.

13.name: Goodbye, Mr. Chips
13.description: An aged teacher and former headmaster of a boarding school recalls his career and his personal life over the decades.

14.name: The Little Princess
14.description: A little girl is left by her father in an exclusive seminary for girls, due to her father having to go to South Africa to fight in the Second Boer War.

15.name: Of Mice and Men
15.description: Two itinerant migrant workers, one mentally disabled and the other his carer, take jobs as ranch hands during the Great Depression to fulfill their shared dream of owning their own ranch.

16.name: Jamaica Inn
16.description: In Cornwall, 1819, a young woman discovers she's living near a gang of criminals who arrange shipwrecks for profit.

17.name: Gunga Din
17.description: In 19th century India, three British soldiers and a native waterbearer must stop a secret mass revival of the murderous Thuggee cult before it can rampage across the land.

18.name: Love Affair
18.description: A French playboy and an American former nightclub singer fall in love aboard a ship. They arrange to reunite six months later, after he has had a chance to earn a decent living.

19.name: The Roaring Twenties
19.description: Three men attempt to make a living in Prohibitionist America after returning home from fighting together in World War I.

20.name: Destry Rides Again
20.description: When a tough western town needs taming, the mild-mannered son of a hard-nosed sheriff gets the job.

21.name: Only Angels Have Wings
21.description: At a remote South American trading port, the manager of an air freight company is forced to risk his pilots' lives in order to win an important contract.

22.name: The Private Lives of Elizabeth and Essex
22.description: A depiction of the love/hate relationship between Queen Elizabeth I and Robert Devereux, the Earl of Essex.

23.name: Son of Frankenstein
23.description: One of the sons of Frankenstein finds his father's monster in a coma and revives him, only to find out he is controlled by Ygor who is bent on revenge.

24.name: Beau Geste
24.description: Three adopted English brothers join the French Foreign Legion in North Africa, after one of them steals their adoptive family's famous heirloom sapphire.

25.name: Young Mr. Lincoln
25.description: A fictionalized account of the early life of the American president as a young lawyer facing his greatest court case.

26.name: The Adventures of Sherlock Holmes
26.description: The master sleuth hunts his archenemy, Professor Moriarty, who is planning the crime of the century.

27.name: Babes in Arms
27.description: A group of vaudevillians struggling to compete with talkies hits the road hoping for a comeback. Frustrated to be left behind, all of their kids put on a show themselves to raise money for the families and to prove they've got talent, too.

28.name: Desperate Trails
28.description: A young boy helps a marshal in his battle against outlaws.

29.name: Drums Along the Mohawk
29.description: Newlyweds Gil and Lana Martin try to establish a farm in the Mohawk Valley but are menaced by Indians and Tories as the Revolutionary War begins.

30.name: Gulliver's Travels
30.description: A doctor washes ashore on an island inhabited by little people.

31.name: The Four Feathers
31.description: A timid British Army officer has quit and burns his last day summons to a war in Egypt. Calling him a coward, his girl friend and 3 officer friends give him a white feather. In redemption, he shadows his friends in war to save their lives.

32.name: Another Thin Man
32.description: An explosives manufacturer suspects a young man is out to kill him. He calls in new parents Nick and Nora to sort things out.

33.name: The Story of Alexander Graham Bell
33.description: The story of how Alexander Graham Bell invented the telephone.

34.name: Union Pacific
34.description: In 1862, Central Pacific and Union Pacific Railroads compete westward across the wilderness toward California.

35.name: Dodge City
35.description: A Texas cattle agent witnesses first hand, the brutal lawlessness of Dodge City and takes the job of sheriff to clean the town up.

36.name: Jesse James
36.description: After railroad agents forcibly evict the James family from their family farm, Jesse and Frank turn to banditry for revenge.

37.name: The Spy in Black
37.description: A German submarine is sent to the Orkney Isles in 1917 to sink the British fleet.

38.name: Made for Each Other
38.description: While on a business trip, an ambitious young lawyer meets and immediately falls in love with a stranger. They wed the following day, and tragedy soon strikes.

39.name: Tarzan Finds a Son!
39.description: Tarzan finds a boy from a crashed plane and raises him with Jane in the jungle. A search party comes looking for the plane.

40.name: Le jour se lève
40.description: After committing a murder, a man locks himself in his apartment and recollects the events that led him to the killing.

41.name: The Man in the Iron Mask
41.description: Despotic King Louis XIV discovers he has a twin brother who has grown up under the tutelage of his foster father, the patriotic musketeer D'Artagnan.

42.name: Intermezzo: A Love Story
42.description: A concert violinist becomes charmed with his daughter's talented piano teacher. When he invites her to go on tour with him, they make beautiful music away from the concert hall as well. He ...                See full summary »

43.name: The Dark Eyes of London
43.description: Insurance agent-physician collects on policies of men murdered by a disfigured resident of the home for the blind where he acts as doctor-on-call.

44.name: The Flying Deuces
44.description: Ollie has fallen in love with the innkeeper's daughter in Paris. The only problem - she's very much in love with her husband. To forget her he joins the Foreign Legion with Stan. Bad idea.

45.name: It's a Wonderful World
45.description: When a tycoon is accused of murder, the private eye tracking him finds himself roped in as an accessory and attempts to evade police, kidnapping a poetess along the way.

46.name: Golden Boy
46.description: Despite his musical talent, Joe Bonaparte wants to be a boxer.

47.name: The Cat and the Canary
47.description: When an eccentric family meets in their uncle's remote, decaying mansion on the tenth anniversary of his death for the reading of his will, murder and madness follow.

48.name: The Three Musketeers
48.description: D'Artagnan sings and fronts for slapstick cowardly Ritz brothers posing as musketeers.

49.name: The Story of Vernon and Irene Castle
49.description: The story of married couple Irene Castle and Vernon Castle, sensational ballroom dancers prior to World War I.

50.name: Confessions of a Nazi Spy
50.description: FBI agent Ed Renard investigates the pre-War espionage activities of the German-American Bund.
